revised_title: Obituary of Sir William Gowers and Richard Lydekker
tldr: This article is an obituary for Sir William Gowers, a renowned neuropathologist, and Richard Lydekker, a paleontologist and zoologist. Gowers made significant contributions to the field of neuropathology, including his work on diseases of the nervous system and the discovery of Gowers' tract. Lydekker was known for his work on fossil vertebrates and his role in organizing the Mammalian Exhibition Galleries at the Natural History Museum. Both individuals were highly respected in their respective fields and made lasting impacts on science.
